history.content:
I assume you saw 3.4 in this section:

"Students who entered UC Berkeley before fall 2015 can apply for early declaration if they have ONE prerequisite remaining to complete in the following semester  (i.e. currently taking prerequisite #5 and #6, and only need to complete the last prerequisite next semester). Students must achieve a 3.40 GPA in those prerequisites at the end of the semester in order to be admitted via early declaration."

This is only for early declaration (and I'm not even sure it's possible to early declare under the new application). 

The general requirement to declare is:

"Students who entered UC Berkeley before fall 2015 must complete CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, CS 70, Math 1A, Math 1B, Math 54 with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.00 in those 7 courses in order to be guaranteed admission to the CS major.

Students entering UC Berkeley in fall 2015 or later must complete CS 61A, CS 61B, and CS 70 with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.30 in those 3 courses in order to be guaranteed admission to the CS major."

It seems like whether you count the FPF semester or not, you'll have to abide by the 3.3 GPA rule, and you can apply once you've finished 61AB, 70

children.subject:
Sorry but I believe the deadline has already passed for applying this semester
https://eecs.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate/cs-ba

"The application deadline is the 15th of the last month of the semester in which you are completing your technical prerequisites: Dec 15, May 15, and Aug 15. "

Okay, thanks! So on the major declaration form, if I havent taken 61c should i just leave that section blank like this?

or do i just say which semester im planning on taking it?

history.content:
Hi, I was just looking at the UCB CS website and noticed that the GPA cutoff is 3.4, also i am a bit confused about when exactly we can declare. I could have sworn that the GPA cutoff was 3.3 and I know I've heard that from several sources. Did the GPA cutoff change?

Also, so I was admitted for fall 2015 (I was in FPF so technically Spring 2016) but idk if that makes a difference. Theses are the courses I have taken:

math 1a/1b, cs70, math 54, cs61a, cs61b (currently enrolled). 

Can I apply to the major this semester or do i have to wait till after I take 61c?
history.subject: l&s CS major declation
